result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(9:43 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.
Defendant Jackie L Shelafoe appeared by phone. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jackie L Shelafoe. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to appear in person and requests to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to appear in person.
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty plea which the Court receives.
Attorney Thorson requests 30 days for filing of motions. Court orders 30 days for filing of motions.
Attorney Thorson advises has received an offer and requests to schedule a status conference in 45 days.
Status Conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10 am in person.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Jackie L. Shelafoe may appear remotely for all proceedings in this matter, subject to further order of the court.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely

3:20 PM case called. Defendant Jackie L Shelafoe appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jackie L Shelafoe.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. Case is referred to Branch 5 to schedule ARGN.

Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates address and phone number. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
